frameDefinitions: This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
A Student enrolls and then remains at an Institution for the purposes of education within a Subject.
This frame deals with testing or examination of someone's Knowledge or skill in a particular area.
An Experiencer is involved in a bodily injury to a Body_part.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Duty needs to be fulfilled by a  Responsible_party.
An Inspector directs his/her perceptual attention to a Ground to ascertain whether the Ground is intact or  whether an Unwanted_entity is present.
frameExamples: Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
He spent ten years <t>studying</t> physics at the lycee before he flunked out.
At the end of the trial period all three groups took an English for Commerce <t><fex name='Examination'>examination</fex></t> to assess progress.
I think that I <t>hurt</t> myself pretty bad back there.
It would <t>behoove</t> us to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples
The police removed Flonnory and Barbour from the automobile and <t>frisked</t> them for weapons.
listRoleDefinitions: One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who receives instruction from a <fen>Teacher</fen> or <fen>Institution</fen>.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught  to a <fen>Student</fen>.
The time when the student is studying.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the studying takes place.

NOTE: Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
One who administers a test of some kind.
One who undergoes a test of some kind.
The ability, practice, or command of information on which an <fen>Examinee</fen> is tested.
A credential or status that one acquires by passing an <fen>Examination</fen>.
The <fen>Examination</fen> that somebody takes.
The time at which the examination occurs.
The location where the examination takes place.
The location on the body of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> where the bodily injury takes place.
The being or entity that is injured.
The time when the harming event occurs.
The place where the harming event occurs.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The time interval during which the <fen>Duty</fen> is mandatory.
A location in which the <fen>Duty</fen>  obtains.
The person who inspects the <fen>Ground</fen> to see if it is intact or without blemish.
The entity that the <fen>Inspector</fen> inspects with his senses to ascertain whether it is intact.
An entity whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the <fen>Ground</fen>.

Some of the words in this frame occur with a constituent that expresses the desired outcome of the inspection.  Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment>, or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Inspector</fen> hopes to find to obtain when inspecting the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Inspector</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
listRoleExamples: She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
She studied <fex>from him</fex> for years.
She studies <fex>astrophysics</fex>.
<fex>The teacher</fex> tested the students.
<fex>The students</fex> took a test.
I took my <fex>driving</fex> test.
He took the <fex>college entrance</fex> <t>exam</t>.
<fex>The examination</fex> tests driving skills.
I cut <fex>my finger</fex> on the envelope.
<fex>The squirrel</fex> abraded <fex>its</fex> tail as it twitched nervously in the confined space.
So you cut your leg on the window frame <fex>at six o'clock</fex>, correct?
She fell and hit her head <fex>out in the playground</fex>.
<fex>Getting a shot against yellow fever</fex> is obligatory for travellers to Benin.
The use of TM software is obligatory <fex>for every freelance translator working on projects for our company</fex>.
<fex>These days</fex>, wearing a seat-belt is mandatory.
Gymnasium is not obligatory <fex>in Sweden</fex>, but nearly everyone attends gymnasium
<fex>Smithers</fex> proof-read my paper on phlogiston production.
`Mister Thomas' said Holmes, `have you examined <fex>the lock</fex> to determine whether or not it has been forced or otherwise tampered with?'
Security guards frisked all the spectators <fex>for weapons</fex> as they entered the stadium.
Check all gutter brackets and clips <fex>to ensure no water will drip on to the walls</fex>.
Check <fex>that the light is out</fex> before you leave.
<fex>Yesterday</fex> we inspected all the taps and water pipes at animal enclosures being utilized

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Veritable Records of King Injong
History of the Three Kingdoms (Samguk sagi)
